Vocabularies.Definition: a. added; extra 附加的，另外的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   An additional charge is made for heavy bags.

Vocabularies.Definition: be attractive or interesting to (sb.) 有吸引力，使感兴趣
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The book will appeal only to a very limited public.

Vocabularies.Definition: ask to come to help in a difficult situation 叫…进来，召来
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We had no hesitation in calling in the police.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. undertake, carry out 从事，进行；主持
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She's conducted the firm's financial affairs for years.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. face (sth.) and try to deal with it 勇敢地面对，正视
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We must confront the future with optimism.

Vocabularies.Definition: (crises) n. time of great danger or difficulty 危机
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We hope we can survive this time of crisis.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. fact, circumstance, etc. that helps to produce a result 因素
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His friendly manner is a factor in his rapid success.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. of an earlier time 以前的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She's back to her former self again.

Vocabularies.Definition: it's one's view 在…看来，…认为
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. In the financial controller's opinion, a raise in salary will increase the total cost.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. cause (sb.) to take part in sth.; include 使卷入，使参与；包括
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Several high ranking officials were involved in the scandal.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. 天生地，天然地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She was naturally shy.

Vocabularies.Definition: 自己选择的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You may either accept or reject his proposal, anyway it's all of your own choice.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (plan for a) scheme or undertaking 计划；规划；工程
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The government has begun a project to increase the size of the harbor.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 范围；幅度；一系列
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The subject is outside my range.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. connect, associate 将…联系起来
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I related his bad mood to a lack of sleep.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. provide a substitute for (sb./sth.) 更换
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   These tires are badly worn and should be replaced.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. find a solution to (sth.) 解决
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   They have resolved most of their difficulties.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. choose 选择
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Which of them did you select for the job?

Vocabularies.Definition: undertake; decide to do 从事，承担
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He agreed to take on the new job.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. very large or great 巨大的，极大的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The storm caused a tremendous amount of damage.
